Package DAGs

Class DAG<N>

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractObjects.ItemWithId
      • DAGs.DAG<N>

  • public class DAG<N>
extends ItemWithId
    This class is the interface to a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG). The graph itself is represented by the abstract class Node together with the two subclasses LeafNode and InnerNode. Each node carries a label of type N (for example, Concept). The distinction between InnerNode and LeafNode is determined by the predicate isLeafLabel to be applied to the labels.
    Example: Labels are concepts like Person, Student, Car etc as well as, e.g. Paul, John, Herbie. The distinction between InnerNode and LeafNode comes from the labels which either denote sets or individuals.
    Therefore in the DAG itself there may be leaf nodes (e.g. Student), which are not leaf-nodes by the labels (there are no students yet).
    The DAG is optimized for a situations where there are few inner nodes, but many leaf nodes. Therefore each node has two lists of subnodes, one with leaf nodes, and one with inner nodes.
    The public DAG-methods are synchronized, whereas the Node-methods are not. Thus, access to the DAG should be only via the methods in this class.
    Changes to the structure of the DAG can be observed by various observers.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addSubnode

        public void addSubnode​(Node<N> superNode,
                       Node<N> subNode)
        adds the node-subnode relationship to the DAG.
        Parameters:
        superNode - , the super-node
        subNode - the sub-node

      • addSubnode

        public void addSubnode​(N superLabel,
                       N subLabel)
        adds the node-subnode relationship to the DAG If the superLabel is not yet present in the DAG it becomes a new root node. If the subnode is already present in the DAG, it is reused (the first time this happens, the tree becomes a DAG).
        Parameters:
        superLabel - the label of an existing node.
        subLabel - the label of the subnode.

      • removeSubnode

        public void removeSubnode​(InnerNode<N> superNode,
                          Node<N> subNode)
        removes the node-subnode relationship from the DAG. If the subnode is an inner node, and has no supernodes anymore, it becomes a root node. The observers are called after the removal.
        Parameters:
        superNode - , the super-node
        subNode - the sub-node

      • removeSubnode

        public void removeSubnode​(N superlabel,
                          N sublabel)
        removes the node-subnode relationship from the DAG. If the subnode is an inner node, and has no supernodes anymore, it becomes a root node. The observers are called after the removal.
        Parameters:
        superlabel - , the super-node's label
        sublabel - the sub-node's label

      • leafNodes

        public java.util.stream.Stream<LeafNode<N>> leafNodes​(Node<N> node)
        returns a stream of leaf nodes below the given node. Multiple occurrences caused by the DAG structure are filtered out using a timestamp mechanism. Two different streams of leaf nodes therefore MUST NOT be processed by different threads in parallel!
        Parameters:
        node - any node
        Returns:
        the stream of leaf node labels.

      • leafNodes

        public java.util.stream.Stream<N> leafNodes​(N label)
        returns a stream of leaf nodes below the node with the given label. Multiple occurrences caused by the DAG structure are filtered out using a timestamp mechanism. Two different streams of leaf nodes therefore MUST NOT be processed by different threads in parallel!
        Parameters:
        label - the label of some node.
        Returns:
        the stream of leaf node labels, or null.

      • leafNodes

        public java.util.stream.Stream<N> leafNodes​()
        generates a stream of all leaf nodes. Multiple occurrences caused by the DAG structure are filtered out using a timestamp mechanism. Two different streams of leaf nodes therefore MUST NOT be processed by different threads in parallel!
        Returns:
        the stream of all leaf nodes.

      • leafNodesRaw

        public java.util.stream.Stream<LeafNode<N>> leafNodesRaw​(Node<N> node)
        returns a stream of leaf nodes below the given node. Multiple occurrences caused by the DAG structure are NOT filtered out (add .distinct() to the stream).
        Two different threads may evaluate two such streams in parallel. While one thread evaluates the stream, another thread, however, must not change the DAG's structure!
        Parameters:
        node - any node
        Returns:
        the stream of leaf nodes (maybe with multiple occurrences of the same label).

      • leafNodesRaw

        public java.util.stream.Stream<N> leafNodesRaw​(N label)
        returns a stream of leaf nodes below the node with the given label. Multiple occurrences caused by the DAG structure are NOT filtered out (add .distinct() to the stream)
        Two different threads may evaluate two such streams in parallel. While one thread evaluates the stream, another thread, however, must not change the DAG's structure!
        Parameters:
        label - the label of some node.
        Returns:
        the stream of leaf node labels (maybe with multiple occurrences of the same label), or null.

      • leafNodesRaw

        public java.util.stream.Stream<N> leafNodesRaw​()
        generates a stream of all leaf nodes. It may contain multiple occurrences
        Returns:
        the stream of all leaf nodes

      • innerNodes

        public java.util.stream.Stream<InnerNode<N>> innerNodes​(Node<N> node,
                                                        boolean inclusive,
                                                        Direction direction,
                                                        Strategy strategy)
        This method computes a stream of inner nodes below the node with the given label. Double occurrences of the same node are filtered out.
        Parameters:
        node - a node
        inclusive - if true then this node becomes the first node in the stream.
        direction - controls the direction of the traversal through the DAG
        strategy - controls breadth-first / depth-first traversal.
        Returns:
        the stream of inner nodes.

      • innerNodes

        public java.util.stream.Stream<N> innerNodes​(N label,
                                             boolean inclusive,
                                             Direction direction,
                                             Strategy strategy)
        This method computes a stream of inner nodes below the node with the given label. Double occurrences of the same node are filtered out.
        Parameters:
        label - a node's label
        inclusive - if true then this node becomes the first node in the stream.
        direction - controls the direction of the traversal through the DAG
        strategy - controls breadth-first / depth-first traversal.
        Returns:
        the stream of inner nodes, or null if the label is unknown.

      • findInInnerNodes

        public <V> V findInInnerNodes​(Node<N> node,
                              Direction direction,
                              Strategy strategy,
                              java.util.function.Function<Node<N>,V> function)
        searches through the inner nodes below/above the given nodes, and including the given node, to find an inner node where the predicate returns true.
        Parameters:
        node - the node from where the search starts.
        direction - either UP or DOWN
        strategy - either BREADTH_FIRST or DEPTH_FIRST.
        function - to be applied to the inner nodes.
        Returns:
        the first inner node where the predicate returns true, or null.

                               Strategy strategy,
                               java.util.function.Consumer<N> consumer)
        This method applies a consumer to the node labels of all all nodes below/above (inclusive) the node with the given label.
        Parameters:
        label - the label of any node of the DAG
        direction - either UP or DOWN
        strategy - controls breadth-first / depth-first traversal.
        consumer - a function to be applied to the nodes label.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Description copied from class: ItemWithId
        just returns the pathname for the object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class ItemWithId
        Returns:
        a string representation of the DAG
